To enable just-in-time (JIT) debugging, the .config file for this

WorkItem.Summary: Font 'Arial Narrow' does not support style 'Regular'

Comments.Message: Forgot to mention that this was on Rawr v2.1.9
Your machine is missing 'Arial Narrow', one of the basic, built-in, system fonts in Windows. Perhaps you deleted it or something? Try reinstalling it from your system discs, perhaps?

Actually, Arial Narrow is not a standard font:

More than 1/10 of windows computers don't have it:

http://www.codestyle.org/css/font-family/sampler-WindowsResults.shtml

The standard fonts are installed on 98% plus of computers.

Arial Narrow was in WinXP.  It was re-tooled for Windows Vista and Windows 7.  There was a bug in the original Vista release which required a windows update to resolve (it had to do with Adobe, but I'm not sure if that could have been the initial cause here).

Regardless, Arial Narrow is a default font for Windows users.  Whether people aren't running windows update, or they are deleting fonts somehow, I'm not sure.  But I'm fairly certain that it's standard on all current Windows OSes

Windows XP does not include Arial Narrow. The font is included in several Microsoft products, including Micrsoft Office. It is also available for purchase separately:

http://www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/family.aspx?FID=22

It would be wonderful if RAWR was fully legible for all Windows XP users.
